Description

Biryani is a rich and aromatic rice dish that hails from the Indian subcontinent, beloved for its bold flavors, colorful presentation, and satisfying layers. Made with fragrant basmati rice, tender meat (like chicken, mutton, or beef), or sometimes vegetables, it's infused with a blend of warm spices like saffron, cardamom, and cloves. Cooked with love and often slow-cooked in a sealed pot (known as dum), biryani is more than just food—it's a celebration on a plate. Whether served at a festive gathering or enjoyed as a hearty meal, biryani is always a dish that brings people together.

Ingredients

  • 500g chicken (preferably bone-in)
  • 1 cup yogurt (curd)
  • 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste
  • 1 tsp red chili powder
  • ½ tsp turmeric powder
  • 1 tsp garam masala
  • Salt to taste
  • Juice of ½ lemon
  • 2 cups basmati rice (soaked for 30 minutes)
  • 4 cups water
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 4 cloves
  • 2 green cardamom pods
  • 1 small cinnamon stick
  • Salt to taste
  • 2 large onions (thinly sliced)
  • 2–3 tbsp oil or ghee
  • A handful of chopped fresh coriander leaves
  • A handful of chopped fresh mint leaves
  • A pinch of saffron (optional, soaked in 2 tbsp warm milk)
  • 1 tbsp biryani masala (optional, for extra flavor)

Method

  1. Mix all marinade ingredients and coat the chicken. Let it rest for at least 30 minutes (overnight is better).
  2. Boil water with salt and whole spices. Add soaked rice and cook till it's 70–80% done. Drain and set aside.
  3. In a large pot, heat oil/ghee and fry onions till golden brown and crispy. Take out half for garnish.
  4. In the same pot with remaining onions, add the marinated chicken. Cook on medium heat until chicken is nearly done and oil separates.
  5. Lower the heat.
  6. Spread half the cooked rice over the chicken.
  7. Add some fried onions, coriander, mint, and saffron milk.
  8. Repeat with remaining rice and toppings.
  9. Cover with a tight lid or seal with dough.
  10. Fluff gently, serve hot with raita, salad, or boiled eggs!
